title: Advanced 3D Visualization-Based Anatomy Education: Exploring the Hard Palate and Surrounding Structures

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic anatomical terminology, foundational knowledge of human body structures
context.additional_context: Advanced anatomy training to strengthen language pathology-related job competencies. Enhancing spatial cognition skills necessary for managerial/leadership roles.

learning_goals: Learners can identify neurovascular structures connected to the pterygopalatine fossa with 80% accuracy using 3D modeling tools.
Learners can utilize 100% of specialized terminology required to explain spatial relationships of complex anatomical structures through small-group collaboration.
Learners report a 75% or higher self-efficacy score for learning effectiveness when using 3D visual materials (physical models/digital images) via formative assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
